en: The shift ends in uneasy silence. Security patrols have doubled. Everyone moves in whispers.
You're heading to your quarters when you hear it - [color=YELLOW]shouting from the officers' wing[/color].
You round the corner to see security forces [pulse freq=3][color=RED]kicking down Sasha's door[/color][/pulse].
Chief Yukon's voice booms. SWEET POTATO SASHA! You are under arrest for [color=CRIMSON]treason against the nation of Spud![/color]
Sasha is dragged out, struggling. Her eyes are defiant even as guards wrench her arms behind her back.
[tornado radius=4 freq=3][color=CHARTREUSE]THE TRUTH WILL COME OUT! YOU CAN'T SILENCE ALL OF US![/color][/tornado]
Her gaze finds you in the crowd of onlookers. Time seems to freeze.
Recognition... then [color=CRIMSON]devastating understanding[/color]. You betrayed her location. She knows.
She doesn't speak. The look is enough. [color=STEEL_BLUE]Disappointment deeper than hatred.[/color]
A flicker of something - [color=CHARTREUSE]hope? trust?[/color] - crosses her face.
Her lips move silently: "[color=CHARTREUSE]The roots grow deep.[/color]" A message. A reminder.
Russet emerges from the shadows, satisfaction oozing from every pore.
Well well. The [color=CRIMSON]sweet potato turns sour[/color]. I always knew there was something rotten about you, Sasha.
Russet holds up a folder. Your little [color=DARK_VIOLET]manifests[/color]. Your "evidence." All recovered.
Did you really think you could undermine [pulse freq=2][color=DARK_VIOLET]Root Reserve[/color][/pulse]? Undermine ME?
Copies are already out there, Russet. The world will know what you do to our people!
Russet laughs coldly. They'll know what we tell them. And you? You'll be part of a [color=CRIMSON]very special batch[/color].
"[color=DARK_VIOLET]Traitor's Blend[/color]" - I think that has a nice ring to it.
Your heart pounds. Every instinct screams to do something. But guards are everywhere.
Step forward and demand they release her (Reckless)
Stay hidden - live to fight another day (Pragmatic)
Catch Sasha's eye and nod - a promise (Resolve)
You push through the crowd. "[color=CHARTREUSE]Wait! She hasn't done anything wrong![/color]"
Yukon's head snaps toward you. "[color=RED]Seize that one too![/color] Clearly an accomplice!"
Murphy grabs you, pulling you back. "[color=STEEL_BLUE]They're confused in the chaos! RUN![/color]"
Murphy shoves you toward a side corridor as guards close in on your position.
Guards grab you. Russet's smile widens. "[color=CRIMSON]Two traitors for the price of one.[/color]"
You shrink back into the shadows, hating yourself with every fiber. [color=STEEL_BLUE]Coward.[/color]
But alive. And free. For now.
You catch Sasha's eye. A slow, deliberate nod. [color=CHARTREUSE]I'm coming for you.[/color]
She sees. The tiniest smile. Then she's dragged around the corner, gone.
He finds you in the chaos. His face is a mask, but his eyes burn.
They took her to the [color=CRIMSON]processing wing[/color]. Sub-level 3. That's where they took my wife.
He presses something into your hand - a [color=GOLD]security keycard[/color].
When the time comes... [color=CHARTREUSE]I'll look the other way[/color]. For my wife. For all of them.
Murphy pulls you into the storage room, breathing hard.
This is it. This is [color=CRIMSON]actually happening[/color]. They've got Sasha. They'll process her by morning.
That was [color=STEEL_BLUE]stupid[/color]. Brave, but stupid. You're on their list now.
The resistance is planning something. Tomorrow. It's our only chance to save her.
Are you in? [color=CHARTREUSE]All the way in?[/color]
All the way. Whatever it takes to save Sasha.
I need to think. This is moving too fast.
Murphy clasps your shoulder. [color=CHARTREUSE]Then we move at dawn. The roots grow deep.[/color]
Murphy's face hardens. Think fast. By this time tomorrow, she'll be [color=DARK_VIOLET]Root Reserve[/color].
You lie awake, staring at the ceiling. Sasha's face. Her defiance. Her fear.
You pull out the photo of the missing wife. Another face you couldn't save.
[color=CHARTREUSE]Not this time.[/color]
By tomorrow, everything changes. One way or another.
[pulse freq=2][color=YELLOW]No more standing on the sidelines.[/color][/pulse]
The cell is cold. Through the walls, you can hear Sasha somewhere, being "questioned."
Tomorrow, they said. You'll both be [color=DARK_VIOLET]processed[/color] together.
Unless the resistance comes. Unless someone saves you both.
[color=STEEL_BLUE]The longest night of your life stretches ahead.[/color]
